page.title: 08Religion in Northill
page.content: Of the 850 souls in the{ecclesiastical {Parish of Northill,}the vast majority would declare their faith as{Christian in its various forms. There is only one building for public worship,{the {parish church of St. Mary Virgin,}(the Living being administered by the Com- pany of Grocers). The church is built mainly of ironstone, and was completed in about 1370. It is currently under- going substantial restoration. About 10% of the population attend regular weekly services, led by the{Rector}and some lay folk. Many are not adherents of the{Church of England,}the estab- lished church, but are welcomed and join in the community worship. The Christian ethic of duty to God and neighbour is evident and the small minority who are of other faiths exhibit this tenet too. The Parishion- ers live together in religious harmony
